alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 11:57PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS CREATING BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS OF THE WASHINGTON AND OREGON BLUE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT... Strong winds with gusts over 55 mph will continue tonight creating drifting of snow across roadways and blowing of snow reducing visibilities to under a half mile at times making driving hazardous. Social media posts from Walla Walla County Emergency Management states multiple roads in the county are impassable due to snow drifts and cars stuck in the snow. Please stay off the roads. Roads impacted from blowing and drifting of snow will be Highway 11 between Walla Walla WA and Pendleton Oregon...Highway 395 from Pendleton to Pilot Rock...Interstate 84 especially from Pendleton east into the Blue Mountains. The drifting and blowing of snow will continue through the night and into Monday morning making driving nearly impossible across some of roads. Please use extreme caution and stay off the roads if possible.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington
